definition: to contend
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
a hundred schools of thought contend (idiom); refers to the classical philosophic schools of the Warring States period 475-221 BC
a hundred flowers bloom, a hundred schools of thought contend (idiom); refers to the classical philosophic schools of the Warring States period 475-221 BC, but adopted for Mao's campaign of 1956
pinyin: bai3 hua1 qi2 fang4 , bai3 jia1 zheng1 ming2

sentences.english: Academic contends on the founding of Periodical Science is a rather fierce topic in the periodicals-related circle in China.
sentences.chinese: 期刊学是我国期刊界学术争鸣比较激烈的研究领域。

sentences.english: The Eastern Zhou period is also designated as a period of a hundred schools.
sentences.chinese: 东周时期也被指定为一个时期的百家争鸣。

sentences.english: It's a highly creative period, and now is the time for ideas.
sentences.chinese: 现在正是百家争鸣，百花齐放的时期。

sentences.english: Qu Qiubai and Mao Dun once contended with each other on the issue of popularization of literature.
sentences.chinese: 瞿秋白与茅盾曾就文艺大众化问题展开争鸣。

sentences.english: He advocated the editorial principles of letting a hundred schools of thought contend and attaching great importance to the academic quality.
sentences.chinese: 提倡百家争鸣，讲求学术质量是他的编辑思想。

sentences.english: Contend is a slogan guiding China's literature.
sentences.chinese: “百花齐放，百家争鸣”是指导中国文学的一条语录。

sentences.english: All kinds of birds are calling to one another in the bamboo forest.
sentences.chinese: 竹林里各种鸟儿在争鸣。

sentences.english: Cai Shangsi advocates academic contending and takes contending as the base for renovation.
sentences.chinese: 蔡尚思提倡学术争鸣，主张争鸣是创新的基础。

sentences.english: Cai Shangsi advocates academic contending and takes contending as the base for renovation.
sentences.chinese: 蔡尚思提倡学术争鸣，主张争鸣是创新的基础。

definition: a hundred schools of thought contend (idiom); refers to the classical philosophic schools of the Warring States period 475-221 BC
a hundred flowers bloom (idiom); let the arts have free expression
thousands of horses, all mute (idiom); no-one dares to speak out/an atmosphere of political oppression
to afford a magnificent sight (idiom)/enchanting
brilliant and varied/(often in the combination 精彩纷呈)
diverse and muddled/many and confused
vying to be the most glamorous/each more gorgeous than the other/beauty contest
to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
the Hundred Schools of Thought, the various schools of thought and their exponents during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (770-220 BC)
lit. phoenix in embryo/fig. young talent/budding genius
songbird
outstanding heroes/warlords vying for supremacy (in former times)/stars (of sports or pop music)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
to pursue deer/fig. to vie for supremacy
(bird) twitter/chirp
